about.note: The metadata provided herein has been generated using the TFL Designer Jazz version 1.5.3. The representation of metadata fields available in this worksheet adheres to the CDISC Analysis Results Standard example available on the ARS GitHub repository.

methods.name: Count by group for a categorical variable
methods.description: Count across groups for a categorical variable, based on subject occurrence
methods.label: Grouped count for categorical variable

codeTemplate.code:
in_data = df2_analysisidhere |>
    dplyr::select(anavarhere, groupvar1here) |>
    unique()
df3_analysisidhere <-
  cards::ard_categorical(
    data = in_data
    bystmthere
  ) |>
dplyr::filter(stat_name == 'n') |>
 dplyr::mutate(operationid = 'Mth_01_01_n')

parameters.name: bystmthere
parameters.description: Combined statement for "variables" and "by" statement in ard_categorical

methods.name: Summary by group of a categorical variable

referencedOperationRelationships.description: The count operation whose result provides the numerator for calculation of the percentage. The referenced analysis should be the analysis that contains this percent operation.

The count operation whose result provides the denominator for calculation of the percentage. The referenced analysis should have the same analysis set and subject grouping(s) as the analysis containing this percent operation.

methods.label: Grouped summary of categorical variable
methods.description: Descriptive summary statistics across groups for a categorical variable, based on subject occurrence

codeTemplate.code:
denom_dataset = df2_denomanaidhere |>
  dplyr::select(denom_anagroupvarshere)

in_data = df2_analysisidhere |>
    dplyr::distinct(distinctlisthere) |>
    dplyr::mutate(dummy = 'dummyvar')

dataDriven = isdatadrivenhere
if(dataDriven == TRUE){
df3_analysisidhere <-
  cards::ard_categorical(
    data = in_data,
    strata = c(byvarshere),
    variables = 'dummy',
    denominator = denom_dataset
  ) } else {
df3_analysisidhere <-
 cards::ard_categorical(
    data = in_data,
    by = c(byvarshere),
    variables = 'dummy',
    denominator = denom_dataset
  ) }
df3_analysisidhere <- df3_analysisidhere|>
dplyr::filter(stat_name %in% c('n', 'p')) |>
dplyr::mutate(operationid = dplyr::case_when(stat_name == 'n' ~ 'Mth_02_01_n',
                                      stat_name == 'p' ~ 'Mth_02_02_%'))

parameters.name: distinctlisthere
parameters.description: list of variables by which to apply the "distinct" function from dplyr

parameters.name: denom_anagroupvarshere
parameters.description: Analysis Grouping variables for denominator dataset

parameters.name: isdatadrivenhere
parameters.description: dataDriven boolean value for highest Analysisgrouping factor
variables to be used in "by" statement
parameters.name: byvarshere

methods.name: Summary by group of a continuous variable
methods.label: Grouped summary of continuous variable
methods.description: Descriptive summary statistics across groups for a continuous variable

codeTemplate.code:
df3_analysisidhere <-
  cards::ard_continuous(
    data = df2_analysisidhere,
    by = c(byvarshere),
    variables = anavarhere
  ) |>
dplyr::mutate(operationid = dplyr::case_when(stat_name == 'N' ~ 'Mth_03_01_n',
                               stat_name == 'mean' ~ 'Mth_03_02_Mean',
                               stat_name == 'sd' ~ 'Mth_03_03_SD',
                               stat_name == 'median' ~ 'Mth_03_04_Median',
                               stat_name == 'p25' ~ 'Mth_03_05_Q1',
                               stat_name == 'p75' ~ 'Mth_03_06_Q3',
                               stat_name == 'min' ~ 'Mth_03_07_Min',
                               stat_name == 'max' ~ 'Mth_03_08_Max'))

parameters.name: byvarshere
parameters.description: string for "by" parameter for the ard_continuous function

subSections.text: LGS= Lennox-Gastaut syndrome; DS= Dravet syndrome; TSC= Tuberous sclerosis complex.
Evaluable Analysis Set includes all participants >= 1 to <= 65 years of age who are enrolled in the study and received at least 1 dose of study intervention.
MEP Analysis Set includes all participants >= 1 to <= 18 years of age who are enrolled in the study and received at least 1 dose of study intervention.

MEA Analysis Set includes all participants >= 19 years of age or older who are enrolled in the study and received at least 1 dose of study intervention. Part B Evaluable Analysis Set includes all participants >= 1 to <= 65 years of age who are enrolled in the study and received at least 1 dose of study intervention in Part B.
Part B MEP Analysis Set includes all participants >= 1 to <= 18 years of age who are enrolled in the study and received at least 1 dose of study   intervention in Part B.
Part B MEA Analysis Set includes all participants >= 19 years of age or older who are enrolled in the study and received at least 1 dose of study intervention in Part B.
One participant was a screen failure and did not have indication collected.

subSection.text: Summary of Indication-associated Seizure Frequency
Part B Flag
LGS= Lennox-Gastaut syndrome; DS= Dravet syndrome; TSC= Tuberous sclerosis complex.
Evaluable Analysis Set includes all participants >= 1 to <= 65 years of age who are enrolled in the study and received at least 1 dose of study intervention.
MEP Analysis Set includes all participants >= 1 to <= 18 years of age who are enrolled in the study and received at least 1 dose of study intervention.

MEA Analysis Set includes all participants >= 19 years of age or older who are enrolled in the study and received at least 1 dose of study intervention. Part B Evaluable Analysis Set includes all participants >= 1 to <= 65 years of age who are enrolled in the study and received at least 1 dose of study intervention in Part B.
Part B MEP Analysis Set includes all participants >= 1 to <= 18 years of age who are enrolled in the study and received at least 1 dose of study   intervention in Part B.
Part B MEA Analysis Set includes all participants >= 19 years of age or older who are enrolled in the study and received at least 1 dose of study intervention in Part B.
One participant was a screen failure and did not have indication collected.

Abbreviations: MEP= Modified Evaluable Pediatrics; LGS= Lennox Gastaut syndrome; DS= Dravet syndrome; TSC= Tuberous sclerosis complex.
LGS-associated seizures include: drop seizure, which is defined as an attack or spell (atonic, tonic, or tonic-clonic) involving the entire body, trunk, or head that led or could have led to a participant’s fall, injury, slumping in a chair, or hitting their head on a surface. DS-associated seizures include: convulsive seizures, which are defined as tonic clonic, tonic, clonic, or atonic. TSC-associated seizures include: focal motor seizures without impairment of consciousness or awareness; focal seizures with impairment of consciousness or awareness; focal seizures evolving to bilateral generalized convulsive seizures and generalized seizures (tonic clonic, tonic, clonic, or atonic) that are countable.
Baseline period includes all data from date of Part A Visit 2 to prior to Part A Day 1. Treatment period is defined as Part B Day 1 to earliest of Part B End of Treatment or 26 week cut-off.

Part B Evaluable Analysis Set includes all participants >= 1 to <= 65 years of age who are enrolled in the study and received at least 1 dose of study intervention in Part B.
Part B MEP Analysis Set includes all participants >= 1 to <= 18 years of age who are enrolled in the study and received at least 1 dose of study   intervention in Part B.
Part B MEA Analysis Set includes all participants >= 19 years of age or older who are enrolled in the study and received at least 1 dose of study intervention in Part B.
One participant was a screen failure and did not have indication collected.

NOTE: N in column headers represents number of subjects entered in study (i.e., signed informed consent). The ITT population includes all subjects randomized. The Safety population includes all randomized subjects known to have taken at least one dose of randomized study drug. The Full Analysis Set population includes all subjects in the safety population who also have at least one post-baseline ADAS-Cog and CIBIC+assessment.
